title: The Nature Conservancy
description: The Nature Conservancy is tackling the root causes of some of the toughest problems facing people and nature today, replicating good ideas to save many places and improve people's lives.
cleaned_text: The Nature Conservancy Stepping Up Progress in this Defining Decade Alongside communities, we're urgently clearing obstacles and finding solutions to the climate and biodiversity crises. [Who We Are](/content/tnc/nature/us/en-us/about-us/who-we-are.html) We are dedicated staff, scientists and members advancing effective, lasting conservation in more than 70 countries and territories. [What We Do](/content/tnc/nature/us/en-us/what-we-do/our-priorities.html) To make the highest possible impact on the climate and biodiversity crises between now and 2030, we're developing breakthrough ideas, amplifying local leaders and influencing policy. [How To Help](/content/tnc/nature/us/en-us/get-involved/how-to-help.html) There are so many ways to make positive change for our planet. Volunteer with us. Learn how to reduce your carbon footprint. Donate to conservation work. [Where We Work](/content/tnc/nature/us/en-us/about-us/where-we-work.html) Dense rainforests, remote coral reefs and the hearts of major cities. Our strategies are as diverse as the habitats and geographies in which we work. Our Mission Conserving the lands and waters on which all life depends Every acre we protect and every river mile we restore begins with you. Your support helps us take on the dual threats of climate change and biodiversity loss across 70+ countries and territories. Get our latest conservation news and see how we're protecting our natural world. Our Goals for 2030 We're racing to hit these targets to help the world reverse climate change and biodiversity loss. Together, we find the paths to make change possible. [View Our Priorities](/content/tnc/nature/us/en-us/what-we-do/our-priorities) - 3B Avoid or sequester 3 billion metric tons of carbon dioxide emissions annually—the same as taking 650 million cars off the road every year. - 100M Help 100 million people at severe risk of climate-related emergencies by safeguarding habitats that protect communities. - 650M Conserve 650 million hectares—a land area twice the size of India—of biodiverse habitats such as forests, grasslands and desert. - 4B Conserve 4 billion hectares of marine habitat—more than 10% of the world's oceans—through protected areas, sustainable fishing and more. - 30M Conserve 1 million kilometers of rivers—enough to stretch 25 times around the globe—plus 30 million hectares of lakes and wetlands. - 45M Support the leadership of 45 million people from Indigenous and local communities in stewarding their environment and securing rights. What's New in Nature Recent updates, immersive stories and relevant explainer articles from around The Nature Conservancy.
